defs: not to be blamed, indicted; incorrupt; irreproachable.
not firm or strong physically; lacking strength.
not firm in mind or purpose; not resolute; vacillating.
a man having infirm mind or lacking resoluteness.
want of physical strength.
the quality or condition of being mentally frail; frailty.
a woman having infirm mind or lacking resoluteness.
that cannot be perceived by eyes; invisible.
out of sight; not apparent; unseen.
that must not be seen; not to be seen.
to disappear from sight; to cease from being seen.
to cease to be seen; to go out of sight; to disappear.
the state of being not seen; disappearance.
(a wrong euphonic combination ) a colourless ink that cannot be seen on paper until it is treated with heat, vapour or a chemical; invisible ink.
a form, figure or structure that cannot be seen by others ( as in mysticism, magic etc.).
one who has gone away from being seen, disappeared or vanished.
a woman who cannot be seen.
that cannot be seen; unseen; invisible.
the seemingly inevitable happening of events that affect someone; fortune or fate that cannot be predicted or foreseen.

good fortune; success, prosperity, advantage, etc. 3) the force believed to cause things, esp. good things, to happen to a person by chance and not as a result of his or her own efforts or abilities; destiny;

ಅದೃಷ್ಟದ ಆಟ adřṣṭada āṭa a game of chance, as gambling etc. 2. (fig.) the ups and downs in one's life believed to have been caused by the destiny; ಅದೃಷ್ಟದ ಏಣಿ ಏರು adřṣṭada ēṇi ēru (fig.) to achieve something or progress mainly by the luck of the draw; to have luck on one's side; ಅದೃಷ್ಟ ಖುಲಾಯಿಸು adřṣṭa khulāyisu (something good) to happen (usu. unexpectedly).
a trial of ones fortune; a test of one's luck.
one of the twenty (sixteen, according to some) ways of peace-making, in which the treaty is concluded by both the parties concerned without having a third person as a mediator.
not seen ever before; being seen for the first time.
the (future) result of a good or bad actions; the result or consequence hidden in the future.
the consequence or result that begets one independent of his or her effort or merit.
(palmistry) a particular line on the palm of a person, which supposedly indicates his fortune; the line of fortune.
a man who gets or got success, prosperity, position etc. purely by chance and not as a result of his efforts or abilities; a lucky or fortunate man.
a woman who gets or got success, prosperity, position etc. purely by chance and not as a result of his efforts or abilities; a lucky or fortunate woman.
not achieving, getting by one's effort or ability, but, subject to the destiny; being in the hands of fate.
success, position or prosperity got by luck, but not by one's ability or effort; good luck; stroke of luck.
luckily; by chance.
the doctrine that all events are subject to fate, and happen by unavoidable necessity; fatalism.
acceptance of every event as inevitable.
one who believes in or advocates the doctrine that fate decides happening of all events, and one's efforts, abilities have nothing in this regard; a fatalist.
one who accepts every event as inevitable.
the invisible power, either divine or fate, that is believed to cause all the events.
= ಅದೃಷ್ಟವಂತ.
= ಅದೃಷ್ಟಪುರುಷಸಂಧಿ.
not having good luck; missing what one deserves by his or her merit or ability; unlucky.
a man who is deprived of his due reward, success, etc.; an unlucky man.
an unlucky woman.
to be available; to be got.
the opposite of 'no' and used to express confirmation; aye; yea; yes; it is so.

causing wonder; surprising, astonishing or extraordinary.

= ಅದ್ಭುತರಸ; 2) a wonderful or astonishing thing; prodigy or miracle; a marvellous person or fact; a marvel.

(Phil.) the most famous of the Indian philosophies which propounds that there is one Reality known as Brahman or the Absolute which always existed and always will exist beyond time and space and the individualātman (soul) is identical with That; the philosophy of Oneness or non-duality.

bureaucracy - a) the administration of government through departments and subdivisions managed by sets of appointed officials following an inflexible routine; b) the officials collectively; c) governmental officialism or inflexible routine, and hence (contemp.) rigid application of regulations and routine in the government administration, resulting in delay in getting business done.

having the position, authority in a government or business organization; being in incumbent of an office.

a position of authority or trust, esp. in a government business, institution, etc; a recognised position or status authorising intervention, application to a court etc.; locus standi.

a woman who has a position of authority in a government or business organisation. 2) a woman who inherits or is legally entitled to inherit, through the natural action of the law, another's property or title upon the otheṛs death; a heir.
